subject: RE: [Read_Alphabet] A few more LOT/CLOTH minimals
msgSnippet: To me homonyms all, (Canadian Accent) Save Paul, which I would spell with Awe. I don t use the word, pol except as part of the word pol-a-tics. I would spell
messageBody:
To me homonyms all, (Canadian Accent)
Save Paul, which I would spell with Awe.
I don't use the word, pol except as part of the word pol-a-tics.
I would spell that syllable with the Awe Vowel too.
Aw Shucks, Paul V.
____________________attached__________________________ 
To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
From: cowan@...
Date: Wed, 21 Nov 2007 01:12:57 -0500
Subject: [Read_Alphabet] A few more LOT/CLOTH minimals

odd/awed, chock/chalk, cock/caulk, stock/stalk, pol/Paul, fond/fawned,
not/nought, rot/wrought.

--
John Cowan http://www.ccil. org/~cowan cowan@...
To say that Bilbo's breath was taken away is no description at all. There are
no words left to express his staggerment, since Men changed the language that
they learned of elves in the days when all the world was wonderful. --The Hobbit
